definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: No wonder his wife is penniless; he is always playing the horses and losing his money. (CDIP)
sentences.chinese: 难怪他妻子身无分文，他老是赌赛马，把钱都输光了。

sentences.english: He got quite cleaned out by gambling.
sentences.chinese: 因赌博他囊空如洗，身无分文。

sentences.english: Dong Xuan train and gave all the money men again, leaving nothing.
sentences.chinese: 董宣又把钱全部赏给部下，不留分文。

sentences.english: Not one penny should be spent for a circlet of gold to testify that we are married.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应耗费分文去买金环来证明我们已婚的身份。

sentences.english: As I was going through that period of financial scarcity, I prayed that I didn’t experience a cash windfall.
sentences.chinese: 在我身无分文的那段时间，我祈祷自己不会大发横财。

sentences.english: But if you just value money than your opinion is worthless.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你只看重钱，你的观点分文不值。

sentences.english: Jane wanted to go to the movies but she was stone-broke.
sentences.chinese: 简想去看电影，但她身无分文。

sentences.english: It would be a cashless journey through the land of the almighty dollar.
sentences.chinese: 那将是一次身无分文的在美元至上的土地上的旅行。

sentences.english: He impecunious is demoralized, be reduced to poverty does beggar to street.
sentences.chinese: 身无分文的他意志消沉，沦落到街头做乞丐。

sentences.english: Many people would rather be penniless.
sentences.chinese: 很多人可能宁愿身无分文也不愿离开手机。

sentences.english: I committed to a year of cashless living.
sentences.chinese: 我决心过一年身无分文的日子。

sentences.english: They extorted every penny from us.
sentences.chinese: 他们把我们勒索得身无分文。

sentences.english: She was often penniless and regularly went hungry.
sentences.chinese: 她经常身无分文定期受饿。

sentences.english: But all they got was the creation of a couple of funds that stayed empty.
sentences.chinese: 但他们得到的是凭空创造出来的资金，分文不值。

sentences.english: He hasn't two sixpences to rattle together.

sentences.chinese: 纳努莉说，他们逃走时手无分文。

definition: to possess nothing except bare necessities/to live a poor or frugal life
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
extreme poverty (idiom); destitute/penniless/poor as church mice
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to scatter money/to give to charity
small sum of money/loose change/Cantonese equivalent of 零錢|零钱[ling2 qian2]
